attributes.name: asi_threat_perception
attributes.description: How the individual perceives ASI primarily: as an existential threat, economic threat, neutral development, transformative opportunity, or utopian salvation.

attributes.name: asi_usage_propensity
attributes.description: Likelihood and eagerness to personally adopt and use ASI tools when publicly available (Early adopter, Willing user, Cautious user, Reluctant user, Refuser).

attributes.name: job_displacement_vulnerability
attributes.description: Perceived or objective degree to which the individual's occupation is rendered redundant by ASI-level cognitive automation (Low, Moderate, High, Already redundant).

attributes.name: personal_medical_stake
attributes.description: Whether the individual or an immediate household member has a condition that ASI-developed cures directly address (e.g., cancer, Alzheimer's, diabetes, ALS, HIV, None).

attributes.name: asi_governance_preference
attributes.description: Preferred approach to governing ASI development and deployment (Unregulated free market, Industry self-regulation, National government oversight, International treaty body, Halt/moratorium).

attributes.name: geopolitical_anxiety_asi
attributes.description: Level of concern about China's parallel ASI development and resulting geopolitical power shift (0=unconcerned, 1=extremely anxious), shaping hawkish vs. cooperative policy preferences.

attributes.name: abundance_distribution_priority
attributes.description: Who the individual believes should receive ASI-enabled material abundance first (Global equal access, Domestic priority, Market-determined, Strategic allies, Local community first).

attributes.name: information_verification_behavior
attributes.description: How the individual responds to extraordinary ASI-related claims in media (Accepts at face value, Waits for consensus, Actively verifies, Dismisses as hype/misinformation, Seeks ASI to verify).

attributes.name: identity_threat_from_asi
attributes.description: Degree to which ASI undermines the individual's sense of personal identity, purpose, or worth tied to their skills and profession (0=no threat felt, 1=profound identity crisis).

attributes.name: asi_corporate_trust
attributes.description: Level of trust in private AI labs (OpenAI, Anthropic, xAI, DeepMind) to act in the public interest during ASI deployment (High trust, Moderate trust, Low trust, Deep distrust).

attributes.name: sci_tech_literacy
attributes.description: Self-assessed and proxy-measured ability to understand scientific and technical claims relevant to ASI milestones (Basic, Intermediate, Advanced, Expert).

attributes.name: community_coordination_role
attributes.description: Role the individual is likely to play in local/community responses to ASI-driven disruption (Leader/organizer, Active participant, Follower, Withdrawn/observer, Obstructionist).

input.notes: Big Five traits already exist in the base population (openness, conscientiousness, extraversion, agreeableness, neuroticism) and are not re-included. risk_tolerance, economic_anxiety, and institutiona...[truncated]
